notes: Complete GG0/GG2025 data validated against official Wyrd card images

plant_explosives.name: Plant Explosives

setup.description: After deployment, each non-peon model in play gains an Explosive token
setup.special: Explosive tokens may not be removed in any other way than placing a marker

scoring.condition: Player with more friendly Strategy Markers completely on enemy table half scores 1 VP

bonus_vp.condition: Have 2 friendly Strategy Markers in (not completely within) opponent's deployment zone

marker_rules.placement: Interact to remove Explosive token, place marker within 1" of self
marker_rules.placement_restriction: Cannot place within 4" of another friendly Strategy Marker
marker_rules.pickup: Interact to remove marker; gain Explosive token if you don't have one
marker_rules.on_death: After a model with Explosive token is killed, the model that killed it makes a neutral Strategy marker within 1" of killed model, if able
marker_rules.movement: Models may move on top of Strategy markers

strategic_notes: Neutral markers from deaths aren't worth points until picked up and re-placed
Markers must be COMPLETELY on enemy half to score
Place markers >50mm from centerline to prevent easy opponent pickup
Build for 7+ bomb interactions on turn 1
Guard placed bombs by standing on them (blocks Interact but not Don't Mind Me)

boundary_dispute.name: Boundary Dispute

setup.description: Each player places 3 friendly Strategy Markers in their deployment zone, at least 6" apart
setup.special: Markers are friendly to the crew that made them

scoring.condition: Player with more friendly Strategy Markers completely on enemy table half scores 1 VP

bonus_vp.condition: Markers completely in enemy deployment zone count as 2 markers

marker_rules.kick_action: Interact with Strategy marker to place it within 6" of its current location, not in base contact with any model(s)
marker_rules.catchup_mechanic: After scoring, player with fewer cumulative Strategy VP may select one friendly Strategy marker and place it within 4" of current location, not in base contact with any model(s)

strategic_notes: Most brawl-focused strategy - push up middle and fight
Double scoring on Turn 4 enables massive comebacks
Deployment zone markers count double - high risk/reward
Control the center to enable safe kicks forward

recover_evidence.name: Recover Evidence

setup.description: Each player makes 1 friendly Strategy Marker completely on enemy table half
setup.special: Additional markers created when your crew kills enemy models

scoring.condition: Player with more Strategy Markers on their crew card scores 1 VP
scoring.reset: After scoring, BOTH players remove ALL Strategy Markers from crew cards

bonus_vp.condition: Remove friendly Scheme Markers equal to turn number from within 1" of terrain within 6" of enemy deployment zone
bonus_vp.special: Uses SCHEME markers, not Strategy markers

marker_rules.creation: After a model is killed by the enemy crew, the enemy makes a Strategy marker within 3" of the killed model
marker_rules.pickup: Interact with friendly Strategy marker to remove it and put it onto that crew's crew card
marker_rules.movement: Models may move on top of Strategy markers
marker_rules.note: You create markers for your OPPONENT when you kill their models - not for yourself

strategic_notes: Encourages AVOIDANT gameplay despite seeming kill-focused
Killing creates resources but exposes you to counter-attacks
Kidnap/forced movement crews are strong here
High scheme scoring expected - plan to scheme heavily
Bonus VP requires deep positioning with scheme markers

informants.name: Informants

setup.description: Place markers at centerpoint, 10" east and west of center on centerline, then each player places 1 marker in center of one table quarter on their side
setup.special: Diagonal deployment has only 1 legal position for player-placed marker

scoring.condition: Player controlling most Strategy Markers scores 1 VP
scoring.control_definition: Most models without Summon tokens within 2" of marker

marker_rules.control: Count models without Summon tokens within 2" of marker
marker_rules.catchup_mechanic: Player with fewer cumulative VP may move up to 2 Strategy markers, placing each within 3" of its current location, not in base contact with any model(s), not within 8" of any other Strategy marker(s)
marker_rules.summon_restriction: Models with Summon tokens cannot contribute to control

strategic_notes: Models with Summon tokens cannot contribute to control - BUT tokens can be removed!
Some abilities remove Summon tokens, making those summons suddenly useful
Can score by controlling your own back marker
Turn 4 doubling enables massive comebacks
Give up early points to position for Turn 4 dominance
Staying power (healing, HP) matters more than killing

breakthrough.name: Breakthrough

reveal_condition.requirement: Remove 1 friendly Scheme Marker from within opponent's Deployment Zone with no enemy within 2"

bonus_condition.requirement: Also remove 1 marker from Centerline AND 1 from your Deployment Zone
bonus_condition.denial: None - no enemy proximity requirement for additional markers

scoring_notes: Scores at END OF ENEMY ACTIVATION - cannot use last activation of turn
Easier to score but may have it Turn 1 requiring sprint
Second point telegraphs your intent heavily

frame_job.name: Frame Job

reveal_condition.requirement: Chosen model takes damage from an enemy attack action that targeted it while on enemy table half

bonus_condition.requirement: Remove a friendly Scheme Marker from within 2" of chosen model at same time

scoring_notes: Four conditions: (1) takes damage, (2) from enemy attack, (3) that targeted it, (4) on enemy half
Scoring is entirely up to opponent - they can lock you out
Don't telegraph too hard - opponent can simply not attack

assassinate.name: Assassinate
assassinate.secret_selection: Choose a unique enemy model with half or more of its max health

reveal_condition.requirement: Reduce chosen model to below half health

bonus_condition.requirement: Chosen model is killed this turn

scoring_notes: Ask about health of MULTIPLE models to bluff
Model must be UNIQUE (not a Minion)
Beware picking this into Frame Job
Very straightforward - rewards doing what you want anyway

scout_the_rooftops.name: Scout the Rooftops

reveal_condition.requirement: Remove 2 friendly Scheme Markers at elevation 2+, on different terrain pieces, not within 6" of your deployment zone, no enemies at same elevation within 2"

bonus_condition.requirement: Remove a 3rd marker meeting same criteria AND completely on enemy table half (can be same terrain piece as one other)

scoring_notes: Consider deployment zone choice based on available terrain
Flying/Expert Climbing/Leap makes this much easier
Two DIFFERENT terrain pieces required for base score
Third marker CAN share terrain with one of the first two

detonate_charges.name: Detonate Charges

reveal_condition.requirement: Remove 2 friendly Scheme Markers from within 2" of enemy models

scoring_notes: Can be near same enemy or different enemies
Requires getting close then spending AP NOT killing
Don't try to score off models that haven't activated (they walk away)
Don't try to score off models you plan to kill
Use low-value activations to force opponent to move expensive models

ensnare.name: Ensnare

reveal_condition.requirement: Remove 2 friendly Scheme Markers from within 2" of a unique enemy model

bonus_condition.requirement: Unique enemy is engaged by a friendly model of lower cost

scoring_notes: Target doesn't need to be the model that just activated
Opponent always gets activation between marker drop and scoring
Don't target models that haven't activated - they'll walk away
Watch for out-of-activation movement that could rescue targets
Model setting up Ensnare can often walk/charge into engagement for bonus

make_it_look_like_an_accident.name: Make It Look Like an Accident

bonus_condition.requirement: Kill that model OR reduce it to below half health

scoring_notes: Very binary - either you have push/pull or you don't
Requires elevation 2+ terrain on battlefield
Some crews are largely immune (Brood, etc.)
If you can't push/pull, don't bother picking this

harness_the_leyline.name: Harness the Leyline

reveal_condition.requirement: Have 2 friendly Scheme Markers on centerline, not within 6" of each other, no enemies within 2"

bonus_condition.requirement: Have 3 markers meeting the criteria instead of 2

scoring_notes: Centerline is HUGE - denial requires spread out enemy presence
Easy to deny with even one model in right position
Free points if you've swept enemy off the board
Often 2 points available late game

search_the_area.name: Search the Area

reveal_condition.requirement: Remove 3 friendly Scheme Markers within 1" of same terrain piece completely on enemy half, no enemies within 2"
reveal_condition.note: Markers don't need to be completely on enemy half, just the terrain

bonus_condition.requirement: Have 1 friendly Scheme Marker next to that terrain

scoring_notes: Three markers is a lot - usually multiple activations needed
Go deep to find terrain opponent isn't near
Harder to deny due to end-of-activation timing
Second point is one of the easiest bonus conditions

take_the_highground.name: Take the Highground

reveal_condition.requirement: Control 2+ terrain pieces of Ht 2+, not within 6" of your deployment zone
reveal_condition.control_definition: Most friendly models standing on terrain piece

scoring_notes: Enemy CAN stand on roof but you can outnumber them
No Interact required - just presence
Must STAY on buildings (can't drop marker and leave)
Harder second point than Scout (need 3 different buildings)
Probably easier overall than Scout due to fewer conditions

grave_robbing.name: Grave Robbing

reveal_condition.requirement: Kill an enemy model within 2" of chosen marker type AND a friendly Scheme Marker

bonus_condition.requirement: After revealing, Interact twice to pick up Remains Markers onto crew card
bonus_condition.unlock: Models gain ability to Interact to pick up Remains Markers after reveal

scoring_notes: Some crews make lots of markers - easy score
Other crews don't - impossible score
Remains Marker pickup gives value to Slam action
Consider what markers your crew naturally creates

runic_binding.name: Runic Binding

reveal_condition.requirement: Have 3 Scheme Markers forming triangle (each within 14" of at least one other), at least 1 enemy inside triangle

bonus_condition.requirement: 15+ Soulstones worth of enemy models inside triangle

scoring_notes: Very AP intensive - dropping markers AND positioning
Impossible to do without telegraphing
Opponent gets chance to deny
Second point often requires 3+ enemy models - very hard late game
Best when models are naturally scattered anyway

reshape_the_land.name: Reshape the Land

reveal_condition.requirement: Have 4 friendly markers of chosen type on enemy table half
reveal_condition.note: If Scheme Markers chosen, they are removed after scoring

scoring_notes: Many crews make markers as part of gameplay loop
5 is the marker cap - opponent can Slam to remove
Scheme Markers: can stand on to protect, but lost when scored
Other markers: may be harder to place but kept after scoring

public_demonstration.name: Public Demonstration

reveal_condition.requirement: Engage chosen unique enemy with 2+ friendly Minions

bonus_condition.requirement: Have a Scheme Marker within 1" of chosen enemy

scoring_notes: Heavily dependent on crew build
Need enough durable, mobile Minions
Some uniques are scary beatsticks - dangerous to park next to
NO anti-summon clause - summons work great here
Don't build specifically for this, but know when you can't do it

leave_your_mark.name: Leave Your Mark

reveal_condition.requirement: Have more friendly Scheme Markers within 1" of centerpoint than enemy markers

bonus_condition.requirement: Exceed enemy marker count by 2 or more

scoring_notes: Very telegraphed but easy if opponent out of position
Two points not much harder than one if uncontested
Don't Mind Me models shine here
Look at board state - obvious if available or not

plant_explosives.reasoning: Already moving markers around, scheme runners are core

boundary_dispute.reasoning: Brawl-focused, models will be engaged anyway

recover_evidence.reasoning: Already killing, spread out for schemes
